title: The Vermont Book Shop
address: The Vermont Book Shop, 38 Main St, Middlebury, VT 05753

user_reviews.description:
Loved this bookshop. They had a great selection of books and an awesome children's area too. The view out the window of the falls behind the building was beautiful. The employee working the day we stopped in was super helpful too, all I could remember about the book I was looking for was that it had an octopus on the cover and the word Creatures in the title lol, and she did a little research and found it for me! And they had it on their shelves too! (Remarkably Bright Creatures 😄)
Definitely worth stopping in to this shop 👍
user_reviews.name: Amy Stanwick

user_reviews.description: I love independent bookstores and this one is fantastic! Full of books, gifts,  and stationary, you can find something for everyone!
user_reviews.name: Nadia Pshonyak

user_reviews.description: Excellent variety, terrific people. The VT Book Shop is a great place to shop! Also, it's nice to actually see something in reality before purchasing, although this time I did order a book, sight unseen! 😁 📚
user_reviews.name: Katie Saunders

user_reviews.description: The very best a Book Shop can be! Cozy and organized with great staff recommendations and constantly rotating window and interior displays to browse on frequent visits. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and very willing to order the rare book you are after that they don't have in stock. This is my yardstick for other book shops and few measure.
user_reviews.name: Stacey Rainey

user_reviews.description: Great place, good selection and they'll order stuff they don't have super easy. Plus the views out the back windows are excellent.
user_reviews.name: Nia W

user_reviews.description: Nice book store, lots of variety and they'll order books in for you. Also sells some local art and prints
user_reviews.name: Charlie Slack

user_reviews.description: Well decorated and organized book store. They have a lot of books to choose from and also stationary that a lot of readers enjoy as part of the journey of reading. They have the local and national newspapers, so it is a plus for me. The atmosphere is quiet and cozy. Great place to spend a few hours navigating around a lot of topics of interest.
user_reviews.name: Gabriela Morgado

user_reviews.description: Fabulous selection of books and original gifts
user_reviews.name: Marina Privorotsky

title: Flying Pig Bookstore
address: Flying Pig Bookstore, 5247 Shelburne Rd, Shelburne, VT 05482

user_reviews.description: Such a cute bookstore with very friendly staff and great collection & curation of books! We are from out of town and really feel like this is a local gem.
user_reviews.name: Olia Q Zhang

user_reviews.description: My favorite bookstore! They have a wonderful selection of books in store and always give good recommendations
user_reviews.name: Katie Grabowski

user_reviews.description: Great help and attention by the staff, they go the extra mile with gift wrapping and ordering books that are out of stock.
user_reviews.name: Gin Ferrara

user_reviews.description: What a treasure! So many good books, local books, children’s books etc. spent quite some time in this special shop. Wish we lived closer I’d be in weekly. Very helpful and friendly staff.
user_reviews.name: Linda Smith

user_reviews.description: Cute book store. Had an array of sections to browse. The staff were SO attentive and eager to help. (They were helping a shopper find a suitable book as a gift for a young person.) It was refreshing to see the staff work as a team to help the shopper. Great little shop!!!
user_reviews.name: Irish Conklin

user_reviews.description: Such a great selection of books. Worth the drive . Spend your money supporting local.
user_reviews.name: Lyn

user_reviews.description: What a charming independent bookstore! Great selection and friendly knowledgeable staff to help find your next favorite book.
user_reviews.name: Sarah Loewer Terio

user_reviews.description: This is a small bookshop, and not really worth the 20 minute drive from Burlington. There is a generous selection of kids books, so if you have kids it might be a great place to browse for books! But otherwise I didn’t find the stock too exciting. Phoenix books offers a much better selection.
user_reviews.name: Faith Robinson

title: Crow Bookshop - Crow Books
address: Crow Bookshop - Crow Books, 14 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401

user_reviews.description: Lovely bookstore with fresh titles. Colorful shelves and apt selection. Browsing relief during walking tours. Well maintained and cozy.
user_reviews.name: Justin Rogers-Cooper

user_reviews.description:
Excellent selection of new and used books in a cozy little bookshop with floor to ceiling shelves! Price stickers on the books come off easily and with zero residue.

The clerk was friendly and welcoming too! 10/10 I look forward to returning next time I’m near! Corvus approved.
user_reviews.name: Brittany Maxey

user_reviews.description: It is a cute little bookshop on Church Street. The staff there were very nice, and pleasant. The prices of the books are very reasonable. For the most part they categorize the books, to make it easier to search. However, I really love romance novels, but they didn't have a category for that, it was just mixed up with the rest of the fiction. That was the only downside that I had with it. I would definitely recommend checking them out.
user_reviews.name: victoria hoods

user_reviews.description: Some interesting books on the shelves, but if they see you take out a cell phone, they'll literally yell at you.  And it's not as if they've a large, comfy reading area in which you can sample books and relish the sounds of silence.  What they have are two stuffed chairs backs to the front window and facing the cash register that you can't sit in for more than ten minutes.  Which is a good thing in a way, because if you need to use a restroom, and don't want to chance another business having a "customers only" restroom policy, you'll have to hike down the street, ascend the steps to the entrance of City Hall, and descend the steps to the basement.  If you're visiting this bookstore, my advice is to walk in, walk around once, make a mental note of books to check out and buy elsewhere, and walk out.
user_reviews.name: Anonymous

user_reviews.description: Cozy, bright, and clean. Not a large shop, but well-curated. Mostly new stock, but some great used treasures sprinkled throughout. Definitely worth a visit.
user_reviews.name: Kenneth Heard

user_reviews.description: Stopped by here to look for used books and they had so many options for each genre. They also have new books and the used ones were relatively priced. Be prepared to walk out with a few books because you won’t be disappointed. Staff were kind and helpful. Definitely recommend if you’re visiting Burlington
user_reviews.name: Parth Jariwala

user_reviews.description: Lovely little shop with a cozy, warm atmosphere and a unique selection of books/puzzles. I usually step in on a whim and end up staying for hours. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Worth stopping in, even for a moment!
user_reviews.name: Melanie Lust

user_reviews.description: Wow what a place! Customer service was great. Such a cozy place.
user_reviews.name: M F

title: Monroe Street Books
address: Monroe Street Books, 1485 US-7, Middlebury, VT 05753

user_reviews.description: I was driving  towards  Middlebury Vermont  an saw this book store it has tons of books to get some you need a ladder  there stacked on shelf  .great place to find a book you want .I found  some Elvis  Presley  books  an bought every  one 6 in all  iam.going back for more
user_reviews.name: Robert St Don

user_reviews.description: My son and I found this fabulous place by accident and when we walked in the door we stopped in our tracks, softly exclaimed "Whoa..." and then proceeded to spend not nearly enough time finding treasures to keep and share. If you love books this is Nirvana. Something for every reader no matter their age or interest. Get there!
user_reviews.name: Jane Maulucci

user_reviews.description: A used book lover's wet dream. My partner and I never fail to find ARMLOADS of interesting, fascinating and mind-blowing books here. Very affordable and the staff are down to earth and super interesting to talk with. Absolutely among the best shops ever.
user_reviews.name: Schlitze Swears

user_reviews.description: Awesome, awesome place.  If you're like me, you usually avoid huge used bookstores because of how chaotic they often are.  Glad I fought that instinct here.  Everything is very well organized and easy to find, while maintaining all of the appeal (creaky shelves and floors, etc).  Very friendly owner who has good stories about the area ane elsewhere.
user_reviews.name: Michael Bartolone

user_reviews.description: I love this place. I’ve been twice now and have had amazing experiences both times. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The prices are fantastic. And they have cool editions of books and I always end up buying copies of books I already own, lol. 10/5 stars.
user_reviews.name: Sierra Tibbetts

user_reviews.description: You walk into Monroe Street Books.  On your direct left is a humbly sized curated shelf of politically and culturally relevant books. Before you are 12-foot high bookshelves teeming with new stories waiting to be discovered. The staff are helpful and smart. You will wish you could spend your whole day hunting through the stacks.
user_reviews.name: Ian McKay

user_reviews.description: You could go into this store for a whole day and not come out having found all of the books you want. Absolutely massive selection! Friendly staff! Absolute must if you're in the area.
user_reviews.name: Owen Kelliher

user_reviews.description: Amazing used book store with a sprawling collection fir all readers and friendly owner.
user_reviews.name: Clyde Derrick

title: Echo Point Books & Media
address: Echo Point Books & Media, 22 Browne Ct #100, Brattleboro, VT 05301

user_reviews.description: My experience with Echo Point has been nothing short of fantastic. I pre-ordered the re-release of Wayne Barlowe’s “Expedition”, a rather rare book, for a friend for Christmas and the edition that Echo Point provided was absolutely gorgeous, with a sleek hard cover and additional content at the beginning. In transit, the binding was unfortunately damaged, and so I reached out to Echo Point through their website. I received an email back almost immediately and Nora from customer service was incredibly kind in her response. After sending some pictures of the damage, I was offered to be either refunded or expedited a replacement. I chose to be expedited a replacement and it arrived in just two days and in perfect condition. Echo Point’s service was incredibly quick, responsive, and considerate, and I would absolutely recommend going to them for your book and novel needs. I know I certainly will from now on :)
user_reviews.name: Jaden Dyer

user_reviews.description: Ordered a book through B&N, was faster than expected. Book condition as good as could be. Little note inside tells you that they'd appreciate it if you leave a feedback. Only complaint is that they forgot to mention who they are on this note, so I had to look up who shipped it.
user_reviews.name: Yang Yeh

user_reviews.description: I looked everywhere for a manual for my college textbook. This was the only place that sold it. They shipped it to me in two days, perfect condition. Totally recommend!
user_reviews.name: Crystal A

user_reviews.description: Had the book I wanted.  Packed well. Shipped within two days.
user_reviews.name: Rs Morris

user_reviews.description: Worked for them this place is great!
user_reviews.name: Nita O'Reilly

title: Phoenix Books Burlington
address: Phoenix Books Burlington, 191 Bank St, Burlington, VT 05401

user_reviews.description: Nice bookstore with a good selection of graphic novels and light board games in addition to books. We did well in the reminders section in the basement - some nice, unusual finds, and and a good variety.
user_reviews.name: Kenneth Heard

user_reviews.description: Nice bookstore with lots of book options, including banned books, worker recommendations and a bargain basement. The only downside is no public restrooms available.
user_reviews.name: Mary McDarby-Rios

user_reviews.description:
Beautiful and nicely laid out bookstore with something for everyone.  The sections are well labeled and it is easy to find the type of book you are seeking.  They also have moleskin and other nice journals, pens, calendars, and other office supplies.  In addition, they have graphic novels, glasses, and games.
There are bargains in the basement.
user_reviews.name: Arielle

user_reviews.description: My favorite local bookstore! I always bring out of town guests here and they always also love it
user_reviews.name: Mari Rose

user_reviews.description: I love this store!! They had so many inclusive book options and a wide variety of lesbian novels!  I’m so happy with my experience
user_reviews.name: Caroline Kidd

user_reviews.description: Always pleasant and helpful. There's no book that I've wanted to read that they couldn't find...priceless!
user_reviews.name: Douglas Corneille

user_reviews.description: AMAZING! A great selection of classic and local books. Fantastic service and staff. Prices on the books were great. The store was clean and well kept. Overall I highly recommend!!!
user_reviews.name: Morgan Baker

user_reviews.description: If your child reads 8 books, they will receive a $10 gift certificate for the store
user_reviews.name: Misty Peck

title: Otter Creek Used Books
address: Otter Creek Used Books, Historic MarbleWorks, 99 Maple St Suite 12, Middlebury, VT 05753

user_reviews.description: Owl Creek Books is the place to be for used book lovers seeking an extraordinary bookstore experience. With their cozy atmosphere and a book oracle like Barbara, they go above and beyond. I knew I couldn’t purchase anything because we were vacationing in Vermont, and our suitcases were already bursting at the seams, but one book called out to me. After we returned home, I sent Barbara an email describing the book (it turned out to not be a terribly accurate description) and its approximate location. Barbara found it for me, and it’s now on its way to me!  I could spend weeks in that store.
user_reviews.name: Jim Needham

user_reviews.description: Wonderful good-sized bookstore in Middlebury's historic Marbleworks with many assorted used and vinatge books. I found a number of unique works that are not in most used book stores as well as some antique books. If you are interested in used books then it's worth a trip to Middlebury...plus the town is very nice and quaint to visit. Enjoy!
user_reviews.name: Craig Bromberg

user_reviews.description: The proprietor was both friendly and helpful. Great selection of books of American History.
user_reviews.name: Dana Smith

user_reviews.description: This is one of my favorite places to hang out and "hide" in to explore when I need some time to think and get away from the "real world." You never know what you're going to find! They always have something new. I also love their fun chairs!
user_reviews.name: Laura Napolitano

user_reviews.description: I love used books! This bookstore has a very nice collection of used books - very well organized. Whenever I am in the Middebury area - I try to stop in. The owners and staff are very pleasant and CAN discuss books and make suggestions! If you love to book browse - this shop should be on your list!
user_reviews.name: Deborah Blair

user_reviews.description:
This is a terrific bookshop with many hard to find volumes in superb condition. The broad and deep inventory is organized carefully and sensibly in a clean, bright store.

I had a chance to talk with the pleasant, gracious and helpful owners ss I checked out and it's clear that they love reading books as much as their customers. I'm now going to make sure that all my future visits to Middlebury include an hour or two browsing through this gem of a bookstore.
user_reviews.name: Timothy Forde

user_reviews.description: A treasure trove of books! Friendly service with a smile ( well a smile behind a mask anyway) and charming and airy atmosphere amid towers of books, with warm nooks to tuck yourself away and consider the words of many great authors. Highly recommend.
user_reviews.name: Kristie Thompson

user_reviews.description: Great selection of used books and all organized nicely. Cozy atmosphere, as well as friendly staff. Also, prices are very reasonable.
user_reviews.name: Katie Dutton

title: Barnes & Noble
address: Barnes & Noble, 102 Dorset St S, South Burlington, VT 05403
description: Bookseller chain stocking housebrand eReader, plus a broad selection of titles for adults & kids.

user_reviews.description:
I can always find many books and great deals here (sometimes too many 😅)

I do miss when there were the computers stationed nearby to search books and sometimes its hard to find someone to ask questions.  However will say that when I do ask for help, I'm always given good customer service.

The Cafe for Starbucks is good.  It is a smaller menu, but there are always fresh Bakery items. And I'm usually able to order some of my favorite drinks.

Overall, I'll say that this location always has many good books and are one of the only businesses open late in the area! The staff is friendly and locating what you need is fairly easy.  I also give props to B&N for always offering ways to save money be it a membership, coupons or bogo days.  This location is a staple and has been around for as long as I'm able to remember, so my review is also steeped in nostalgia. I would definitely recommend coming here!
user_reviews.name: Tasha May

user_reviews.description: Excellent selection of titles including a very large clearance section! What I loved most was the extensive and well stocked Manga and graphic novels section. Most series have complete sets available for purchase and lots of reviews from staff members.
user_reviews.name: Bailey B.

user_reviews.description: Large and open store. Clean with friendly staff. The genre sections has above-average variety (e.g., the horror shelves were not just King). Surprisingly, they have a large used and remainders room that we found well worth the time to pick through.
user_reviews.name: Kenneth Heard

user_reviews.description:
- impossible to find books with way they are organized. Last two times i came in, books in stock could simply not be found. Even if you can find a staff member, still unlikely to find the book with help. Not alphabetical, nonsensical. Witnessed others leaving a section shaking their heads as well.

Two stars for still being a brick and mortar bookstore but leave it to Barnes and Noble to blow any chance at competition with Amazon.
user_reviews.name: Dylan A

user_reviews.description: I love Barnes and noble, always have. My 3 year old son loves visiting the book store. We never leave without spending at least 50 dollars. Today was the first time we were greeted by a security guard at the door . Which is fine, definitely more security is needed these days! I started noticing he would show up to every section(and we visited them all) and would get close,  pick a book up and pretend to look at it. After the 4th time I started feeling uncomfortable.  I agree with watching the store, completely. But I didn’t appreciate it to this degree. It started to make me angry and super uncomfortable. He did this so many times I wanted to ask what his issue was. Don’t make your customers feel like this. Watching is one thing but following someone to this extent is not necessary. Especially for absolutely no reason !!
user_reviews.name: Sara Morrill

user_reviews.description: Very impressive selection but my only complaint would be that I couldn't find a clearance selection. Might just be a pet peeve of mine but something I like to browse through. Still a lot of things you can find.
user_reviews.name: Jonathan Dubord

user_reviews.description: They completely rearranged the store since I last remembered going to look at books.  They have a pretty good selection though. However, if you are a student pilot, look elsewhere at one of the local flight schools as B&N has very few aviation books.  Nice coffee shop but be warned: THEY DO NOT TAKE REGULAR STARBUCKS GIFT CARDS!!!
user_reviews.name: Bennett Townley

user_reviews.description: I was excited to be in a city with bookstores. And I have always loved Barnes and Noble. So when I saw there was one not to far from where we were at the time I jumped at the chance of going. I had been wanting to get some books and they had the one that I was looking for.  So I purchased it and left. We got to the car thinking that was a little pricey for the book, but I really wanted it. So I went online seeing if the book was supposed to cost that much, it was Not!! It was $15 cheaper online.  So we returned it and we got the book online. I did buy 2 other sale books from the money we got back. Just curious of why that was so much more in the store? Maybe overhead is a lot?
user_reviews.name: David Kellogg

title: Phoenix Books Essex
address: Phoenix Books Essex, 2 Carmichael St Suite 2, Essex Junction, VT 05452

user_reviews.description:
Fantastic selection of books.  I'm always pleasantly surprised that what I'm looking for is either on the shelf or on order.  Special orders are always very easy.  Our family also loves journals and there is a nice supply of those in stock as well.
I LOVE being able to support a locally owned small business.
user_reviews.name: Jennifer Bishop

user_reviews.description: I love Phoenix Books, the focus on local work while still keeping a great selection to browse is ideal.
user_reviews.name: Shannon Cygnus

user_reviews.description: Such a cute little ship that packs in so many goodies--bools, gift, local crafts. I love Phoenix so much
user_reviews.name: Courtney Kleppinger

user_reviews.description: When I day dream about creating and designing my own indie bookstore - Phoenix Books is one of my biggest influences! They have such a wide variety of genres with plenty of staff recommendations sprinkled throughout. They have authors events and community events frequently. I always leave inspired and with my TBR list a couple books longer!
user_reviews.name: Bailey B.

user_reviews.description: Great little shop. Nice folks, nicely curated selection.
user_reviews.name: Eric Alwine

user_reviews.description: What an amazing place!!! The first time I went there, I felt like home. The employees are very kind and welcoming. Phoenix books store, is one of the best place I love to go without any tiredness.
user_reviews.name: Fadhili Achinda

user_reviews.description:
Such a lovely small business filled with wonderful books and gifts. And anything they don’t have they can very quickly order. The membership option is a great way to support them while also getting closer to prices one can find online. We have to support our small businesses especially bookstores. Because these kinds of places are the spots that give people jobs and make our neighbors thrive.

Also, Katie and the team are a dream! Every single visit is filled with helpful staff members checking in and offering warm conversations, suggestions or help. Have been so thrilled to be a patron of this small business. And can’t wait to keep shopping here.
user_reviews.name: Ali Hartman

user_reviews.description: Great place to hang out check out new stuff if you got children it's amazing at toys that make them think and learn stuff very high quality merchandise and a very nice calm setting.
user_reviews.name: Michael Allen

title: Chelsea Green Publishing
address: Chelsea Green Publishing, 85 N Main St, White River Junction, VT 05001
plus_code: JMXH+VQ White River Junction, Hartford, VT

user_reviews.description: Love your books. I did not know that you sold them directly from your website.  Shipping was meticulous, books in perfect condition.  I appreciated your sale.  I was able to buy some books that I have been eyeing for a long time.  I also saw more that I will be purchasing soon.
user_reviews.name: Kim Heinis

user_reviews.description:
This is my second purchase. from your company and I'm very pleased with the books we've chosen. High quality and well produced. We appreciate the quality of the paper you use and enjoy reading each page. Thanks for your excellent customer service.
Peggy Helbling
user_reviews.name: Rick Helbling

user_reviews.description: I am thrilled with my first order From Chelsea Green! book is so much easier to handle. I will be ordering again.
user_reviews.name: Sandy Rollins

user_reviews.description: Best publishing company out there. Amazing selection of timely books, fast shipping, and excellent packaging. I’ll definitely be supporting them anytime I can instead of Amazon.
user_reviews.name: Caleb McCann

user_reviews.description: Chelsea Green always delivers superior products in a timely manner. My latest purchase arrived ahead of schedule and is an excellent read so far!
user_reviews.name: Glen Schulte

user_reviews.description: I bought 5 books this last time around and what motivated me was the articles. recipes and excerpts from the books.  That gave me a better feel for whether i really wanted them.  I've skimmed through several so far and am definitely delighted with them
user_reviews.name: Christa Suggs

user_reviews.description: Excellent selection of books and the COURAGE to publish what goes against the prevailing narrative. That's been true for the last twenty years, at least.
user_reviews.name: Roy Hurley

user_reviews.description:
I purchased 2 books of the Preserving Without Canning or Freezing.  I owned a copy many years ago but it never got returned from whoever I loaned it to so,  with my new copy, and one to share I'm not loaning it out again.

It's one of those keepers.  I've used many of the recipes and my favorites are the chutneys and coulis.

I'm going to have to do the in ground silos this year so looking forward to making that happen.

This is a great little book and full of so much information and recipes.  Don't let the size fool you.
user_reviews.name: Judith Smith

title: Bridgeside Books
address: Bridgeside Books, 29 Stowe St #1, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676

user_reviews.description: A small but wonderful independent bookstore in Waterbury.  The owner Katya is delightful to speak with and is happy to order you any book you choose.  The bookstore is adjacent to a great cafe, so you can purchase a book and have a leisurely lunch or coffee in the same building!
user_reviews.name: Ray Doherty

user_reviews.description: Great little shop in a perfect location to pick up a novel or a book for the kids while away from home.  Close to other area interests.  Quality books, local authors, greeting cards and games for families!  FRIENDLY KNOWLEDGABLE STAFF!
user_reviews.name: Tom Johnson-Medland

user_reviews.description: Adorable bookstore with an interesting selection of books, games and other gifts, and an antique phonograph. Employees are friendly and helpful.
user_reviews.name: Brandice Roberts

user_reviews.description: Great selection of books for all ages. The bookstore also has a good selection of teas and gifts as well..Excellent mulled cider tea samples as well.
user_reviews.name: Nicole Moy

user_reviews.description: Loved the board game rental ($6 for 1 week). We had so much fun playing Ticket to Ride. Staff was incredibly friendly and inviting. We purchased books as well.
user_reviews.name: Martha Rodriguez

user_reviews.description: Such a cute little book store! There selection is curated so well for such a small shop
user_reviews.name: Bean Spills

user_reviews.description: Was here in 2020 when she opened  and was back today to visit June 2nd 2023 Katya was very nice and the book store is amazing  place.
user_reviews.name: pia Hurlburt

user_reviews.description: Great little bookstore with a nice selection and good staff in Waterbury
user_reviews.name: Stosh Kowalski

title: The Bookstore
address: The Bookstore, 8 Conant Square, Brandon, VT 05733

user_reviews.description: This independent bookstore in the heart of downtown Brandon always has the latest on the Indie Bestseller Lists as well as the classics. They carry a complete collection of the Vermont Middle-Grade Children's Book Award List (formerly known as the DCF Award) and will special order books for you. The Bookstore has an excellent selection of cards, puzzles, and games. It's a quiet and comfortable place to shop where you can take your time to browse and always find something new, no matter how many times you go. A real gem in this small community.
user_reviews.name: Vicki Disorda

user_reviews.description: Good selection of current young adult books. Friendly staff.
user_reviews.name: Drew Weirshousky

user_reviews.description:
The Bookstore is a small independent bookstore located in Brandon, Vermont. My bookclub has had meetings there on a regular basis before the pandemic and we certainly miss it. The vibe is very welcoming and while their inventory is limited by space, they will do everything they can to get a copy of the book you're looking for. They also have a friends/rewards program for you to join for around $30 a year where you can earn free credits for a certain amount you spend.

I highly recommend visiting if you're ever in the area!
user_reviews.name: Laura Napolitano

user_reviews.description: Amazing! Caring staff and full shelves, there’s something for everybody.
user_reviews.name: Leo Pond

user_reviews.description: Whenever I happen upon an independent bookstore the urge to browse usually pushes me right through the door. It's not as if I am seeking a specific volume to purchase but rather just to immerse myself in a comfortable environment for a while. The Bookstore in Brandon, VT provided just the right experience. New titles were prominently displayed and there were shelves that beckoned to be explored. YA novels were available as well as picture and board books for the youngest literature enthusiasts. A visit is well worth your time.
user_reviews.name: Carl Thornton

user_reviews.description: We are so fortunate to have this amazing independent bookstore in Brandon. The shelves are lined with the latest releases, bestsellers, classics and thought-provoking titles. The conversations with the staff are the best part of the experience, though!
user_reviews.name: Lindsey Berk

user_reviews.description: A welcoming local bookstore with hospitable staff.
user_reviews.name: laura ruhlman

user_reviews.description: Wonderful little bookstore with the MOST friendly staff. Great stop in a busy day for some good reads. Support local!
user_reviews.name: Robert Hopkins

title: Speaking Volumes Books
address: Speaking Volumes Books, 377 Pine St, Burlington, VT 05401

user_reviews.description: Advertises as a used bookstore, but some sections were almost all new books and the used books in others were fairly common stock. Some rarer high prices items, and a nice section of literary journals. The three dollar bargain books our front were left out during the rain. We hit every used book store we can when travelling. Four heavy readers with diverse tastes walked out with nothing, which says a great deal about the selection and pricing. You might do well I'd your needs match up with the right section. The store is clean and organized and the staff were pleasant.
user_reviews.name: Kenneth Heard

user_reviews.description: This was a great stop. The young lady was super kind and helpful. I found many books. I waiver on the fifth star. I thought the prices were a little high (the records were steep) but the place had many great choices at your finger tips. And you didn't have to pay postage. I did make purchases and was excited to bring home surprises.  I would highly recommend making this a stop (wrote down a few authors before entering :)  )
user_reviews.name: Kelly Culligan

user_reviews.description: Absolutely love this bookstore!! They have an amazing selection of used books and have great new ones as well. Just walking in you feel transported to another book-filled world 📚✨
user_reviews.name: Catherine Emil

user_reviews.description: Excellent store with a hug selection at reasonable prices. The owner is  also very kind, knowledgeable and patient. Highly recommend a visit.
user_reviews.name: natana gill

user_reviews.description: Highly recommend for everything they do, but especially the stereo repair services. Wow! My 60's Realistic receiver had a dead channel, and not only did Winfield fix this, but he also cleaned it up and now it looks as good as it sounds. Thanks y'all!
user_reviews.name: Micah Plante

user_reviews.description: Had a great experience here. The owner of the store helped me out and I really appreciated it. Super cool vibe all around!
user_reviews.name: mikey phalen

user_reviews.description: Great variety of rare editions as well as mass-market new releases. Plenty of parking.
user_reviews.name: Laura Sprogis

user_reviews.description: I brought in a CD player that wasn't working.  Showed them the part that had broken off and he quickly determined it wasn't worth fixing. He had some used one for sale at great prices, bought one, very nice guy carried it to my car for me.  The new/used player works awesome!!
user_reviews.name: Kelcy Delibac

title: Next Chapter Bookstore
address: Next Chapter Bookstore, 14 N Main St Suite 02, Barre, VT 05641

user_reviews.description: I stopped in and was greeted by the owner both human and doggo. Very nice. Did not buy anything, the few books I was looking for were not there. The owner asked if she could order them for me but I didn't live local. Truly worth the visit.
user_reviews.name: Kelly Culligan

user_reviews.description: The worst customer service I have ever experienced.  I attempted to call to check on an order that had been placed over a month ago and apparently my cellphone came up as spam risk on her caller ID so rather than let me explain why I was calling she proceeded to scream at me that I was spam risk and she was not talking to me and then proceeded to hang up.  I tried to call back several times and she would pick up the phone and slam it down.  I ended up leaving my office to go to the store in person.  Once on-site the owner was all giggly like hanging up on a customer was funny.  She made all sorts of excuses as to why it took so long to get the book when in fact she waited to place the order until she had enough to get free shipping.  I will never patronize this establishment again and will be sure to let others know
user_reviews.name: Kim Kimball

user_reviews.description: Not open during published hours. I’m attempting to complete the Vermont indie bookstore challenge and the hours at this store are very difficult for someone like me who lives out of state. I’ve been trying to get here for 2 years. I finally drove over an hour out of my way to get here and when I finally found it (the sign is very small and it’s in the back of a parking lot), the store wasn’t even open. The store shares a building with a coffee shop and the workers there said this was normal. I’m all for shopping local, but don’t this store shouldn’t be included in the challenge if it can’t keep consistent hours.
user_reviews.name: Emily Waller

user_reviews.description: When we travel, we enjoy supporting independent book stores. We are always pleased with the personalized service and the unique charm of each store... However, in this case, we didn't even have the opportunity to see the charm. The woman who was behind the counter was less than pleasant. When Wife#1 asked if there was an available rest room, the woman was quite rude. There was clearly a bathroom in the children's section of the store. I'm not sure why we were not allowed to use it. We would have stayed to browse and would have, more than likely, made a purchase; but we chose, instead, to move on...
user_reviews.name: Two Whimmin

user_reviews.description: I had such a positive, upbeat exchange with owner Cynthia D that I’m writing to say that a short visit to Next Chapter may improve your whole day. NC has a discerning selection of a wide range of books. In my far flung conversation with the owner, we hopscotched enthusiastically from author to author. I bought Anthony Doerr’s new book, two New Yorker 500-piece puzzles, Peter Miller’s VERMONT PEOPLE photo album, and a satirical greeting card. I’ll return to conclude our fun, appreciative conversation about Logger personality Rusty DeWees and cartoonist extraordinaire Jeff Danziger. Five Stars. Don Hooper, Brookfield, VT
user_reviews.name: Don Hooper

user_reviews.description: Cynthia and Next Chapter have been a great source for my book needs during the pandemic. I am able to order online and pick up my purchases from the store. Cynthia has always been super friendly and helpful. Support your local bookstore!
user_reviews.name: Opal Grace Jones

user_reviews.description:
I've had a dismal experience on the customer service side of this bookstore.

I mistakenly ordered a book from Next Chapter in early June. I meant to order from a store of the same name in St. Paul, MN. After a little phone tag, I was able to get in touch with the owner and we arranged for the book to be shipped to me...Fast forward to a month and a half later, the book still hasn't arrived and none of my messages have been returned.

As a former bookseller and current indie bookstore patron, this really bums me out. No book, no refund, and no communication. This review is the LAST chapter in my attempt to understand what the hell happened. For your money, patronize Next Chapter in Barre, VT in-person. If something goes wrong with your shipped order, they will leave you high and dry.
user_reviews.name: Amber James

user_reviews.description: Next Chapter Bookstore is by far the nicest book shop in the area. Cynthia and her staff are so helpful in assisting you with finding the perfect book. And if by some chance they do not have it in stock, they get it shipped to the store for you super-fast at no extra cost. And after you are done getting your new book, you can stop in for a Bagel next door!
user_reviews.name: Mike Lannen

title: Champlain College Campus Store
address: Champlain College Campus Store, 375 Maple St, Burlington, VT 05401
description: Campus bookstore chain offering new, used & digital textbooks, plus school-branded merchandise.

user_reviews.description: It's a college bookstore, so the target audience is pretty specific. That said, it's well-stocked, well-organized, and usually staffed by a friendly-enough student. Prices are quite reasonable.
user_reviews.name: Tim White

user_reviews.description: Pretty solid campus store. In a pinch, a majority of needs can be filled here from food to most course materials. It is limited in scope, but it's effective for what it needs to be.
user_reviews.name: Daniel VanRyn

user_reviews.description: Amazing place to find your school books, or some snacks and drinks for the dorm! The staff is amazing, especially Ally!! They also have some technology and school supplies so it's really a one stop shop.
user_reviews.name: Chris McCammon

user_reviews.description:
Inventory is defenitely lacking quite a bit, however, staff is consistently helpful and nice. Most of the time, I have resorted to ordering online because an item was not sold.

Place is good in a pinch for picking up some dorm necessities but I would reccomend avoiding the makeup. Due to how long it has been there, I recieved a tube of mascara completely glued shut. Upon forcing it open, the wand had snapped off and the product was completely solid.

To make up for it, the college merchandise is of good qualitiy and there is pretty good sales that occur often. For books and pencils and really good coffee, the store is decent. Do not get your hopes too much though!
user_reviews.name: BETRAYAL HERNANDEZ

user_reviews.description: It has a variety of basic college supplies, including some electronics like laptops. It's quite pricey to shop here, and their goal is to simply make money of you. Not help you get an education.
user_reviews.name: Gavin Hieronymus

user_reviews.description: Pretty nice place! Lots of books and shirts for dads. Make sure to bring your dad, or if you're a dad make sure to come here. Great deals for dad!
user_reviews.name: Mike Grill

user_reviews.description: Greatly improved from the previous year when it wasn't located in the new building. This one now actually serves as a quick stop to grab snacks, coffee, or school supplies.
user_reviews.name: Elliot Schneider

user_reviews.description: Got all of my books easily. Staff was very helpful getting me my books and figuring out how to get the one I needed to order online
user_reviews.name: RJ Morrison

title: UVM Bookstore
address: UVM Bookstore, Dudley H. Davis Center, 590 Main St, Burlington, VT 05401

complete_address.street: Dudley H. Davis Center, 590 Main St

user_reviews.description: UVM holds our heart. Husband went to undergrad here. Great place
user_reviews.name: Kimone A

user_reviews.description: There's something special about college tours. We've purchased a lot of UVM gear and haven't even committed yet! Everyone is so happy here 😊 This store carries everything your student will need.
user_reviews.name: Amy LaCasse

user_reviews.description: Great bookstore.  Lots of UVM merch.
user_reviews.name: Christopher Kimler

user_reviews.description: Thanks for staying open a bit past closing so we could grab a present for our incoming freshman!
user_reviews.name: jeff handler

user_reviews.description: This store has ALL of your UVM needs at great value
user_reviews.name: Chad Paré

user_reviews.description: Heather was wonderful in helping me with a gift exchange.  Her customer service skills are impeccable.  The bookstore is lucky to have her!!
user_reviews.name: Judi Olmstead

user_reviews.description: Has all the catamount gear you could ever want. Friendly cashiers and staff as well! Pop in for maple candy, a baseball hat, or some golf balls, this store has quite a range of options. It's also the one stop shop for all things graduation. Get a cap and gown, tassel, and a diploma frame when they go on sale (usually in mid April)
user_reviews.name: Renee Willard

user_reviews.description: Lots of options. Students were on break so we had the entire store to ourselves. It was large and open with lots of fun UVM gear!
user_reviews.name: Emilie Sullivan

title: Tempest Book Shop
address: Tempest Book Shop, 5031 Main St, Waitsfield, VT 05673

user_reviews.description: Wonderful community book shop offering both new and pre-owned books of varying subjects. Owner is very friendly and helpful. Enjoy!
user_reviews.name: Craig Bromberg

user_reviews.description:
My totally favorite bookstore in Vermont. Spent $10 on a bunch of gently-used books and the Tempest steers some of my dollars to a food assist kitchen nearby.

There is a thing called perfection if you just look for it.
user_reviews.name: Andrew Cervini

user_reviews.description: I stopped by this bookstore last summer on my way up to camp, and I haven’t stopped thinking about it since! I bought a book about the origins of Tarot, and it’s been a great book. I love the owner, he was so sweet and very interesting to listen to. Would recommend!
user_reviews.name: Mirabel Gonville

user_reviews.description: In a world where book stores are becoming far and few between, this is an excellent hidden gem!!  I've had nothing but great experiences there with the owner Rick.  For example, I was in need a a quality knot tying book, I called Rick and was amazed at the wealth of knowledge, not only that it's like he has the store inventory in his head, but all that he knew about the book!!  Do yourself a favor and skip Amazon, stop in or call Rick!!  He also changes watch batteries and bakes amazing bread!!
user_reviews.name: Hazen Ball

user_reviews.description: Very unique stop in vermont. A wide variety of books, children to adults. Don't miss the fresh local bread sold on Saturday's.
user_reviews.name: Kathy Dow

user_reviews.description: There is so much to be found at the Tempest! Huge selection, knowledgeable staff and some of the best bread anywhere. If what you are looking for isn't there already, Rick will find it!
user_reviews.name: Karrie Thomas

user_reviews.description: I've visited Tempest countless times and have never come away with the slightest hint of disappointment or without a smile on my face.  Rick is the ultimate bookseller - as knowledgeable, scholarly, helpful, kind, caring and sharing as you will ever find. He is a well-educated, friendly, customer-oriented book seller successfully running his own independent shop. If you are accustomed to buying books at one of the big name stores, where customer service is hard to find and you may even have to chase someone to get an answer, you will find a warm Vermont welcome and answers to all your book-related questions at Rick's.
user_reviews.name: ROBERT MIDDLETON

user_reviews.description: If you love bookstores you've got to come here. This place is jam packed with a great selection of stuff from bestsellers to classics. Everyone is bound to find something they want even if they don't know what that is yet. Also you gotta buy the homemade bread! It's fantastic!
user_reviews.name: Karen Piatt

title: Phoenix Books Rutland
address: Phoenix Books Rutland, 2 Center St, Rutland, VT 05701

user_reviews.description: I used to think this was a decent bookstore for what it was until a few things happened or surfaced. After the mask mandate was dropped my family and I had gone in planning to look around only to be told in a very rude manner that if we didn't have masks to leave. We were both fully vaccinated. It was uncalled for. I lost respect for Phoenix books in that moment. Secondly I had learned that a few friends of ours who are local authors had been screwed over by Phoenix having their books banned and not recieved their dues for all their book sales.Their customer service lacks severely never asking once if we ever needed help they would rather chat amongst themselves. I'd rather shop at Bookmobile and online then ever go into Phoenix bookstore ever again. Lost my business forever. If you're looking for a pleasant bookstore experience don't go to Phoenix.
user_reviews.name: Tessa Babus

user_reviews.description: The staff is always courteous and helpful. If you are a frequent and avid book buyer I highly recommend the book club. The selection of books, stationary, and gifts is excellent. If they don't have a title you are looking for in stock, the ordering process is simple and reliable. Staff are always clear about expected timetable, the likelihood for delays, and communicative about changes. Easily one of my favorite shops in Rutland!
user_reviews.name: Melissa Rixon

user_reviews.description: I went in hoping to get a couple of books and a gift- I was the only person in the store with two people working- not one of them said anything to me or offered to assist me with finding anything. The selection was rather sparse, as I couldn't find any of the books I was looking for- both fairly popular new releases. I had hoped for a nice experience in an actual bookstore, and to maybe get a few suggestions for future purchases- I guess I will stick to Amazon.
user_reviews.name: Genevieve Sobel

user_reviews.description: Phoenix Books is a nice locally owned book store. The carry most titles in print. I happened to be browsing through local section and found an autographed copy of a non-fiction book by one of my favorite local author. I eventually bought it. The staff at the store are very nice and friendly. They will help you find a book or a gift you're looking for. If it's out of print, they'll try to get it for you. You usually wouldn't leave this empty handed.
user_reviews.name: Stan Payne

user_reviews.description:
Excellent customer service great people, knowledgeable, local highly recommended you need a book they can get it good old fashion book store with a modern touch. Keep it up.

Update:
Apparently since the pandemic customer service has gotten worse. That comment was 3 years ago. With cdc guidelines dropping masks mandates and schools also giving kids the option not to wear a mask in schools.  Its lost on phenix.
They rather turn away business if a customer doesn't wear mask. (I'm vaccinated) i didn't realize they made that kind of money to turn customers away not when they have had the rent and utilities subsidized for a few years now.
Of course it is their business not mine so i myself will never give them any more of my money and my family has agreed not to go in there any more either. Its a shame i am a big supporter of supporting local businesses i think everyone should that is why our downtown looks so blank with everyone shopping online ive always gone to the local shops first and i will with the other ones still open in downtown but that one.
user_reviews.name: Michael G

user_reviews.description: Awesome bookstore with great gift options as well.  I was looking for books for middle school aged children and they had a great young adult section and loads of graphic novels.  This is a great bookstore!
user_reviews.name: J.P. Dinosaur

user_reviews.description:
Normal book prices, wish they also had used books. (Originally published, 5 years ago.)

UPDATE:

If you're looking for local authors, you might need to look elsewhere. Apparently there known to "ban" books if it comes through Amazon. Which in defense is local Book Publishers are going out of business, and so that makes it now even harder for local authors. And now I'm hearing they don't pay what is owed from local creators, I'm done supporting a place that isnt helping local authors.

They may try to reply to this and others. But trust me, I know a few titles and work, you can't find anymore. Nor, are they paying them there dues.
user_reviews.name: Paul Dulski

user_reviews.description: The people are always so kind and helpful, the book club that they have gives you great deals, and it's such a calm environment. One of my favorite bookstores, for sure
user_reviews.name: Ayla Sharii

title: Bear Pond Books Store
address: Bear Pond Books Store, 38 Main St, Stowe, VT 05672

user_reviews.description:
Modest and quaint bookstore.
Happy to find it when we were vacationing in the Stowe area.
I am conflicted as to the pricing because, the new reality is the prices and convenience of Amazon chance your experience at a brick and mortar retailer.
That being said- I’d highly recommend stopping by and shopping locally while you’re in Town.
There really is nothing better than buying a book on serendipity, rather than an algorithm: although there are merits to both.
Happy shopping and reading!
user_reviews.name: eric j

user_reviews.description: A nice bookstore with a wide variety of books  to choose from. Walkways in the store can be a bit tight, especially on a crowded day but it's still worth checking out. Prices are normal compared to other bookstores.
user_reviews.name: C B

user_reviews.description: Awesome local book store!
user_reviews.name: Hannah Jo

user_reviews.description: This is a quaint bookstore in downtown Stowe, VT. They sell a variety of greeting cards from local craftspeople. I must say that I found the artwork on the cards to be beautiful and inspiring. The store sells a large selection of children's books, fictional, historical, autobiographical books as well as books that fall into other genres.
user_reviews.name: Caroline Karimi

user_reviews.description: Great selection of books. Displayed beautifully so you can see them easily. Organized in great sections. Wonderful gifts and greeting cards. FANTASTIC jigsaw puzzle selection. And they allow dogs inside. My favorite bookstore to date.
super cute and we spent a lot in there but it was fun and worth it
user_reviews.name: Lori Kerfren

user_reviews.description: This was an awesome bookstore! We loved the selection. Everyone in our family (mom, dad, 2 kids, 2 Nana's) enjoyed perusing all of the choices.  So many great books.
user_reviews.name: Katie M

user_reviews.description: This place is the best bookstore in the area. The staff are incredibly nice, very helpful, and always smile when I walk in. They have a decent collection of Vermont books along with some very nice cards, both handmade and not. Their kids section is amazing and they have a large selection of recent novels. The science section is small, but they have the important books. My favorite part of the store is bookshelf right in the middle near the register that is "staff picks". I always find something interesting there.
user_reviews.name: Oliver Ames

title: The Vermont Book Worm
address: The Vermont Book Worm, 270 Overlea Rd, North Bennington, VT 05257

title: Yankee Bookshop
address: Yankee Bookshop, 12 Central St, Woodstock, VT 05091

user_reviews.description: Visited this bookstore twice in the past two months, and on both visits the staff made me feel unwelcomed. As I entered, I always greeted the staff with a "Hello." Both visits I got no response from either of the ladies behind the register. Both visits I purchased books. None of the ladies looked me in the eyes nor said anything, other than the total amounts. Both visits were cold and callous. Does the female staff hate men? Clearly, I am not welcomed at Yankee Bookshop. I prefer, and recommend, Norwich Bookstore. At least the staff there is friendly.
user_reviews.name: Jerry Horn

user_reviews.description: this great bookshop doesn't just sell books it curates them.
user_reviews.name: Mark Zanetti

user_reviews.description: This is a nice small independent bookstore with great gift ideas and very welcoming staff.
user_reviews.name: S W

user_reviews.description: Cute shop. Great selection of books and some other cool stuff.
user_reviews.name: Tracey Aldrich

user_reviews.description: What a beautiful bookstore! Great staff, helpful and friendly. So much fun to visit.
user_reviews.name: Jason Rice

user_reviews.description: Woodstock itself is a great town to visit. I go 3-10 times a year. But the one place I always make a point to stop in and shop from is Yankee Bookshop. A perfect little bookshop with a good selection of books. I can always easily find something I have to have. Yeah you can buy books online for convenience but we need bookshops like this for the experience.
user_reviews.name: Sabrina Moore

user_reviews.description: Loved this shop! Some really cool finds in here and the staff were friendly
user_reviews.name: Jaci Schneider

user_reviews.description:
Cozy bookshop that lets you wander around and read, and will order any book that’s in print! Happened upon here while visiting the town for something else, and am glad to have done so. Sadly, didn’t have the time to stay longer.
They are kid friendly, too. My friends’ kids were reading quietly on the floor of the age appropriate section, and were not disturbed.
user_reviews.name: Ankita Sarkar

title: The Eloquent Page
address: The Eloquent Page, 70 N Main St, St Albans City, VT 05478

user_reviews.description: Lovely bookshop with a variety of titles and genres in a very peaceful part of town. Very fair prices too - about what you'd find on Amazon, but with the benefit of supporting an indie bookshop. They also have blind bags of books that you can buy for $1 in different genres that come 3 books to a bag. It reminds me a little of the Hamilton bookshop in NYC.
user_reviews.name: Kailyn Champlin

user_reviews.description:
I've been to many used bookstores all around Montreal, the North Country region in NY, and Vermont, and The Eloquent Page surprised me the most by its combination of wide range, high quality selection, and very reasonable, if not bargain, prices.
There are things for everyone of all ages, but the real good stuff is in the literature and philosophy sections. Lots of classics in collectible editions that will fit anyone's library shelf.
The store is well lit with tall ceilings, staff if friendly and knowledgeable, and all the prices are clearly indicated. I am told they also buy and trade books at fair values.
Worth many visits!
user_reviews.name: J.Y. Zhang

user_reviews.description: Cute, quirky and affordable Indie Bookstore! They have a little bit of everything including antique and rare books as well as unique historical books about the local area. They also frequent have a free books stand outside that you can check out if finances are tight. Eloquent Page is almost always my first stop when I'm looking to add to my growing TBR list.
user_reviews.name: Bailey B.

user_reviews.description: A nice corner bookshop in the center of St Albans. The lady who works here is very friendly and is very knowledgeable. A very wide selection of books and some other misc things like bookmarks and candles and such. The new and used books are all mixed together but they are all in order and categorized. If you're a book lover, I would check this place out.
user_reviews.name: C B

user_reviews.description: This is a must stop! Loved it! Friendly and knowledgeable staff, great book selection! I can not say enough of this place LOVE, LOVE this place
user_reviews.name: Mona Ditcham

user_reviews.description: Such a great collection of books, everyone is sure to find something they love. Top notch selection of board books to encourage the youngest of readers.
user_reviews.name: Emma Holcomb

user_reviews.description: Love this bookstore! Located right on Main Street in St Albans, they not only have a great selection, but also a knowledgeable, friendly and helpful staff. I was able to get all of the Colleen Hoover books I was looking for locally, which was great! If you cannot find the book on the shelves for some reason, they can help order it for you, it's such an easy process. Highly recommend going here :)
user_reviews.name: Lauren Warshofsky Personal

user_reviews.description: MUST STOP HERE!!! It's more than a bookstore! There are some hidden treasures here and the owner is so nice. It's Vermont at its finest.
user_reviews.name: Brad Sargent

title: Recycled Reading of Vermont Books & Instruments
address: Recycled Reading of Vermont Books & Instruments, 1 Main St, Bristol, VT 05443

owner.name: Recycled Reading of Vermont Books & Instruments (Owner)

user_reviews.description: Looking for a place to enthrall you with all the reading, puzzling, doodling, drawing, painting, musical and old-school gaming options you could hope for? Stop here; this independent shop is brimming; likely to inspire all your rainy, Sunday and creative days for the next ten years. Fair prices. Friendly service.
user_reviews.name: Amber Foote

user_reviews.description: Love this little shop! Packed to the brim with goodies. I stopped in to browse used books and found a whole section of dungeons and dragons stuff and bought a tarot deck! They even had calligraphy pens and inks in all colors, as well as some specialty paints. Very cool store for creative hobbies.
user_reviews.name: Devon Harding

user_reviews.description: Great place to go for books, music instruments/sheet music, and art supplies. The selection is really good, and the prices are better than what you'll find at alot of other places. I use this as my one-stop-shop for all of my creative endeavors.
user_reviews.name: Thomas Work

user_reviews.description: Best place for a bored mind. The owner is a delight and fun to chat with about anything! You can also get a plethora of trading cards here, along with tabletop games
user_reviews.name: Vadim Fogel

user_reviews.description: Great selection of puzzles, ranging from 500 piece, 750 to the 1,000 sets. Nice kids corner, and an impressive selection of guitars, music books, etc. Highly recommend!
user_reviews.name: Angela Welch

user_reviews.description: Amazing number of discovered goodies for a small shop. Prices are often much less than the list price. There are also art supplies, games, and goodies to find. Well worth a stop and you can special order!
user_reviews.name: Abbey LaMay-West

user_reviews.description: This is one of the best indie music stores you're going find. The welcoming environment and excellent selection of instruments make this gem worth seeking out.
user_reviews.name: Healing Honeybee

user_reviews.description: Stopped in to explore the art supplies. Decent selection and reasonably priced. Got everything I needed to get back to painting, for less than I would have spent at Amazon. Great place.
user_reviews.name: Douglas Perkins

title: Northshire Bookstore
address: Northshire Bookstore, 4869 Main St, Manchester Center, VT 05255

user_reviews.description:
Wow, what a great bookstore. I’ve been to quite a few, especially as an author, and this one rivals even the Book Loft in Columbus, Ohio that has 32 rooms. I really enjoyed the layout of the store and that it was adjoined to a cafe. The sections were clearly marked, the inside felt cozy, the staff were nice, and they even had an upstairs for kids (with a really neat metal staircase).

The bookstore itself is in a historic house, which is also really neat and it’s right in the middle of downtown. I really have nothing bad to say about it.
user_reviews.name: Joseph Carro

user_reviews.description: This place is amazing! Not only does it excel as a bookstore, it also excels in its selections of puzzles, toys, and other fun gifts! There is plenty of seating, it’s very family and kid friendly, there is a book for everyone here, and the decor is immaculate! I can’t say enough good things about this bookstore!
user_reviews.name: Livia Cahill

user_reviews.description:
An excellent bookstore worth a stop or even a small detour.
The selection of books is stellar and up-to-date.
There are also candles, vinyl records, stationary, diaries, a cafe for food, coffee, signed books, rare books, and used books!!!
user_reviews.name: Jakob W. Plummer

user_reviews.description:
Fun bookstore. Knowledgeable staff.
Large inventory of new and lightly used books.
Also available: games and gifts for all audiences.
Elevator available.
Cafe.
Lovely gardens.
user_reviews.name: Sanne Kure-Jensen

user_reviews.description: Any time I travel I make it a point to locate a local bookstore. As they are few remaining. Mother nature changed my hiking plans for the day which I think was a blessing in disguise so that I would find this hidden treasure filled spot. I felt like a kid in a candy store. Every corner there was something new I just had to see. I could have stayed there for hours just exploring the many options to sit, stand, walk, talk, eat or all of the above. What a perfect opponent to slow down grab a book and some coffee or tea and just be. Everything else can wait. Do yourself a favor and remember this place. Bookmark it in your place of favorite places to stop by when traveling through.
user_reviews.name: La Nissa Dyman

user_reviews.description: One of the best bookstore I've ever visited. Extensive selection of books and other goods and even a cafe upstairs. Wish we could have spent more time there.
user_reviews.name: Soy B. (SoyB)

user_reviews.description:
When of my favorite bookstores ever, my family and I have been going there for over 17 years and have seen it expand and get better with time. The people that work there are fantastic and you should always try them for recommendations.

I was there end of September 2018 the cafe was closed for renovations. You can easily lose yourself here with all the nooks and cozy places to sit with checking out the books.

While i do buy books online, no online review can match the personalized recommendations I have received over the years. People that work there are truly passionate about books.
user_reviews.name: Ziad Iskandar

user_reviews.description: Wow! What a bookstore! So we’ll kept and such great picks. Really a fantastic place to spend some time and shop good books.
user_reviews.name: Jennifer Himmels

title: Faith Bible Book Store
address: Faith Bible Book Store, 7 Christian St, Hartford, VT 05047

title: Yellow Barn Books Inc.
address: Yellow Barn Books Inc., 39 Quaker St, Lincoln, VT 05443

title: UVM Bookstore
address: UVM Bookstore, 46 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401

user_reviews.description: Great shop and lovely employees, stopped by to get UVM merch and prices were really good and great selection:)
user_reviews.name: Aloha

user_reviews.description: Pricey for actual books but a great place to get UVM gear; shirts, memorabilia if you are a student or alum.  They have some fun dorm items here as well as long-boards, ukulele's and such.  Nice place to browse if you are in town and have some affiliation with the school.
user_reviews.name: Rick Valenta

title: Galaxy Bookshop
address: Galaxy Bookshop, 41 S Main St, Hardwick, VT 05843

user_reviews.description: Love this small book store right in the heart of Hardwick. Small amounts of every genre for everyone. A plus- they will order books for you which come in a timely manner. Neat little kids corner. Assortment of community activities go on in the store on a regular basis. Lots of gifts, games etc. A few chairs, a bench and bean bag chair to sit and read. Owners are community driven, and go above and beyond with customer service...and then there's their store mascot "Boo", he's very well mannered!
user_reviews.name: Anne-Margaret McElroy

user_reviews.description: Absolutely adore this bookstore. I put in orders and they always arrive quickly. They give me a phone call whenever it's ready to pick up and are always so kind. They usually have some good recommendations for books to check out too. They also have an adorable selection of stickers, tiny cards, and various other little bits. I can't overstate how happy I am to have found this bookstore!
user_reviews.name: Sarah

user_reviews.description: Galaxy Bookshop is one of the only places I am sure to visit every time I'm in Hardwick. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the selection of books is incredible. I highly recommend.
user_reviews.name: J. O'Brien

user_reviews.description: This is a great little shop! I stopped here and picked up Obama's memoir and grabbed a cute pin. The person working was friendly and helpful. There are safety protocols in place for Covid-19 and I felt totally comfortable there. Can't wait to visit again!
user_reviews.name: Opal Grace Jones

user_reviews.description: Great little bookstore...  Super friendly and knowledgable staff.
user_reviews.name: Paul Graven

user_reviews.description: They have a warm and inviting atmosphere. You can browse and actually just sit and read in one of their comfy chairs. A play area for children. Contests, raffles. And a wonderful staff. I would recommend this store just as a pit stop for its lovely environment but supporting them is a worthy cause. They also have great sales.
user_reviews.name: Ronda Rae Parker

user_reviews.description: This is a small, but great bookstore. It has local authors and many wonderful books in all genres. They have always ordered books when I have asked - and have had great suggestions. I love to go in there during the winter  - they have chairs to sit as you browse titles you might like to take home!
user_reviews.name: Deborah Blair

user_reviews.description:
I live in Vermont and needed to get a gift to my sister in Virginia.
Ordered a book online for her from the Galaxy Bookshop.
Ordered a bunch of other stuff online at the same time too, from seven other businesses.

Out of everything I ordered, the Galaxy present got there first, beating out all the other businesses despite it being the height of the COVID pandemic/Christmas rush season.

I'd also requested no price on the packing slip because it was a gift.
They honored this request, and in addition, I just got this excited text from my sister: "the present is wrapped in blue snowflake paper.  It's so pretty!"

Thanks Sandy for the happy surprise of a great wrapping paper job, and for super speedy shipping.
user_reviews.name: Tippy Cam

title: The Bookmobile
address: The Bookmobile, 17 Center St, Rutland, VT 05701

user_reviews.description: Can spend hours in here. Wide selection of books & other fun stuff. Friendly knowledgeable owner. An asset to Rutland stores!
user_reviews.name: Deidre Snee

user_reviews.description:
Best book store in the area!

Mostly used books, but also some new books, cards, and gifts. Not only is the selection phenomenal, the prices are affordable for everyone. In fact, sprinkled in the used books are "local" prices for things that go for much more online.

Like classics? Like craft books? Like design books? Like books on the outdoors? Like spirituality and religion reads? Like Vermont authors? Like fiction and the best deals on mass market paperbacks you can find? Come to the bookmobile!

And if you can't find the book you are looking for, you can go across the street to phoenix books making the whole trip a great destination. You can find recorded music, plants galore, toys, coffee, sandwiches, local beer, and spa treatments (and more!) just on this one block alone downtown in walking distance of the bookmobile.
user_reviews.name: Sean B

user_reviews.description: Nice store.  Always find somethingI need to take home with me, although some sections haven't had much new content added since my visit a year ago.  But I'll still stop back in during my next visit to the area.
user_reviews.name: Baaye Fevens

user_reviews.description: Love this place! Lots of new, and used books at great prices. The gentleman that owns it is so pleasant. I've been there twice since my friend took me there in the fall.
user_reviews.name: Gina Barker Capek

user_reviews.description: One of my fave places in town!! Has a home like charm & the owners are very friendly & always polite!! I love getting great deals on books that I otherwise would be spending 3 times as much on!! Every used book I find is like a lost treasure coming home to be part of my precious collection!!
user_reviews.name: Sherry Farr

user_reviews.description: Exactly what we were looking for while on vacation: the most helpful shopkeeper directed my son to exactly what he was looking for.  Walked out with EIGHT books all in great condition for what we would have paid for two elsewhere.  Great spot.  Lovely shop.  Give them your business.
user_reviews.name: Kirsten Erlandsen

user_reviews.description:
Easy going and decent books.

UPDATE:

Great place for used books, also carries new selections. Let's help keep small businesses like these around.
user_reviews.name: Paul Dulski

user_reviews.description: Love it here! Wish some of the kids books were a little bit cheaper but the selection is great and so is the staff.
user_reviews.name: Nina Dubois

title: Vermont Center For the Book
address: Vermont Center For the Book, 136 Main St, Chester, VT 05143

user_reviews.description:
Vermont Center for a book is one of 50 different centers all affiliated and linked with the Library of Congress.

Their mother goose program tries to build self-esteem and better reading practices for kids.
user_reviews.name: Steve Estelle

title: Norwich Bookstore
address: Norwich Bookstore, 291 Main St, Norwich, VT 05055

user_reviews.description: Nice selection, plenty to browse and choose from. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Great little store.
user_reviews.name: Andrea Schneider

user_reviews.description: I was having trouble finding a specific book. I called the store and they looked for it, found it and put it aside for me to pick up tomorrow. Very friendly and helpful.
user_reviews.name: Claire Mayock

user_reviews.description: The two employees working in the bookstore were both incredibly helpful, and the bookstore was a pleasure to walk around on both floors. I look forward to shopping there again and again.
user_reviews.name: John Weiss

user_reviews.description: Excellent selection, wonderful independent bookstore. Great staff!!!
user_reviews.name: Nikki Coulas

user_reviews.description: A nice book store with a good selection of books. Not the biggest selection of books, but what they had was a diverse selection across subjects. The staff is friendly and helpful. Make sure to sign up to receive a birthday discount!
user_reviews.name: Noah W

user_reviews.description: Excellent selection of books, journals, cards, wrapping paper, and all sorts of lovely things. The staff couldn't be nicer or more knowledgeable.
user_reviews.name: Diane Strickland

user_reviews.description: Lovely independent bookstore, you can even take a seat in a comfy leather chair and peruse a book without being disturbed.  Owner is very knowledgeable, she even gave us a recommendation for a fabulous restaurant in the area.
user_reviews.name: Anna D.

user_reviews.description: A great book store! Lots to chose from, some old classics and current titles. A super helpfull staff. I love the chairs so you can read a bit before you buy...great place, great feel.
user_reviews.name: Bud Hill

title: The Country Bookshop
address: The Country Bookshop, 35 Mill St, Plainfield, VT 05667

user_reviews.description: The most exceptional antiquarian book store in all my travels. A labyrinth of rooms with rows and rows of organized books spanning every genre from every time. Fair prices and even a free shelf of great books on the porch. An incredible gem hidden in the green mountains.
user_reviews.name: Austin Grant

user_reviews.description: This is a not-so-secret Vermont treasure that is absolutely worth the visit time and again. Pro Tip: They do have half price sales every so often. Go see this treasure for yourself today!
user_reviews.name: Django Soulo

user_reviews.description: There are not a lot of great used book shops around and this is certainly one of them.  Can spend a lot of time here traveling the world in history art and music with loads of cook books as well.  Lots of cards and inexpensive books as well as high priced first editions.  A good place to escape for a bit and take home a great book.
user_reviews.name: John Charles

user_reviews.description: Never been anywhere like this before. There were so many cool and unusual books there. Loved and will definitely go again
user_reviews.name: James Roush

user_reviews.description: Wonderful bookstore spent over an hour and want to return.  Such variety and so well organized.
user_reviews.name: Mary O'Brien

user_reviews.description: So quaint
user_reviews.name: Shelly Meeks

user_reviews.description: Very friendly knowledgeable staff. A very decent selection of used books.
user_reviews.name: Shai Horowitz

user_reviews.description: Amazing collection if folk music books!
user_reviews.name: Jeanne Segretto Miller

user_reviews.description: A wonderful small town bookshop with a great selection! Everything is very neat and organized and the shopkeeper was very nice! Even gave us a couple free candies to try when we showed interest in some unique and awesome candy bar flavors. Definitely will be back again!
user_reviews.name: C B

user_reviews.description: Nice little book store, neatly organized, lots of genres, used book section and kids room. Aesthetically pleasing. Interesting history... was an old carriage house and residence, a bank and several other shops before the owner of the book store moved in. Owner was pleasant and knowledgeable. I didn't find what I was looking for but had a nice visit and conversation.
user_reviews.name: Anne-Margaret McElroy

user_reviews.description: A beautiful shop with an enormous children's selection and a large collection of local publications. Ebenezer Books also carries numerous zines, which is a surprising find, and has a wide enough selection to satisfy any customer. I was particularly pleased to see so many titles by James Baldwin and Octavia Butler, two authors I have a hard time finding in other shops. The space itself is also beautiful, housed in a century-old brick bank. The vault door is still accessible from the shop floor.
user_reviews.name: Max Eddy

user_reviews.description: What a lovely little shop! I took a detour through Johnson on my way back home to Southern VT from Montreal, and on a whim, I poked my head into this bookstore. They had a nice selection of titles, using their snug space well. I bought a small book on the chakras. When I returned a few minutes later and asked if I might use their restroom, the woman at the counter said, "Of course!" I will certainly return here the next time I'm in Johnson. It's worth a stop if you're in the area.
user_reviews.name: Gillian Culff

user_reviews.description: Lovely bookstore with carefully curated selection. There is an impressive selection of zines and small press publications. Good fiction and poetry. There is even a little selection of used and discount books where I always find something.
user_reviews.name: Kazys Varnelis

user_reviews.description: Super awesome book store, surprising and interesting selection of fiction as well as great staff recommendations.
user_reviews.name: Lauren Hwang-Finkelman

user_reviews.description: I ordered a travel book at this bookstore and two monthes later called to find out why I hadn't gotten it. The book was eventually found and I was told they "didn't think I was really coming to get it" which I thought strange. It had been put on the shelf. I did buy it there but have never been back since. I miss Ryan's !
user_reviews.name: linda bishop

user_reviews.description: Thank you to Emily! A wonderful shop and hoping to return soon.
user_reviews.name: Katie Streit

title: Hermit Hill Books
address: Hermit Hill Books, 95 Main St, Poultney, VT 05764

user_reviews.description: I love stopping here every time I'm up this way in Poultney/Middletown Springs. Patty is very friendly and incredibly knowledgeable about books and authors. Every book title I brought up she knew of. Vast selection is all divided up by topics, including many 1st/1st editions as well as signed and inscribed volumes. As usual, I purchased a half dozen books about the American Revolution. A must stop!
user_reviews.name: Matthew Shea

user_reviews.description: This place has a wonderful, rich selection worth exploring. I found some real gems in the psychology section, as well as some really great books in several categories. It's well organized, the prices are very fair, and the cat is a friendly, purring ball of love.
user_reviews.name: Vanessa Bright, LAc LP

user_reviews.description: Cute shop fair prices the kids and I enjoyed looking around and each found a book .
user_reviews.name: Kim Moulton

user_reviews.description: I visited this store yesterday and was impressed with the owner, her doggies and the inventory. However, I think fir used books, they are priced too high. I looked at one book I was interested in. It had some discoloration and was 11 years old. The cost was $7.50, which I think is way too high for a used book. If the prices were lower, I would have bought more books and spent more money. Other than the cost of the used books, the rest if the experience was great.
user_reviews.name: Kathleen Holbrook

user_reviews.description: The owner found some great VT books for me.
user_reviews.name: Karen Amundsen

user_reviews.description: I was looking for a book for a friend to round out a birthday package. Patty was able to offer several interesting alternatives across several topics - just the right thing. A wonderful place to browse.
