user_reviews.name: Elizabeth Ayers

user_reviews.description: Great selection. Can browse quietly. Many coffee table books. Many books in the Vermont section, children's and young adults, science fiction and mystery sections. Local authors and many other sections to browse. You'll need a few hours. Have fun.
user_reviews.name: Heineken500

user_reviews.description: Cute bookstore in a cute town. They had a great selection of used books, both fiction and non-fiction. Prices were reasonable and the cat and dog were good company.
user_reviews.name: Miles Farnsworth

title: Trafalgar Square Books
address: Trafalgar Square Books, 388 Howe Hill Rd, North Pomfret, VT 05053

user_reviews.description: Beautiful area to visit.
user_reviews.name: VermontGuide

title: Star Cat Books
address: Star Cat Books, 157 Main St, Bradford, VT 05033

user_reviews.description: Lovely little bookshop! The owners were super nice and they immediately knew what to recommend me after less than a minute of browsing. One of the highlights of our Vermont trip
user_reviews.name: Erica Popoca

user_reviews.description:
Fantastic new and used bookshop!  I was very pleased with the selection and service provided by the staff.  Everyone is very friendly.
I enjoy young adult fantasy novels, and was thrilled to find many to choose from.
Be sure to give Gabby the cat a pet on the head while you are shopping.  She is so cute.
Thank you Star Cat Books, I look forward to shopping with you again.
user_reviews.name: Terrence Burke

user_reviews.description: I love this place, the warm atmosphere and amazing staff gave me an unforgettable experience. There was also an adorable cat that made everything just that much better. I will be sure to come back soon!
user_reviews.name: Ruoxiao Wu

user_reviews.description: Loved this bookstore, a very diverse selection of books. The person working at the bookstore was very knowledgeable about different types of books and had some very good recommendations.
user_reviews.name: Stephen Manuel

user_reviews.description: Was delighted to discover this gem of a bookstore. A wonderful and diverse collection of books. It's hard to imagine that you could stop by and not pick something up. A great local business to support, and the prices are very reasonable. Nancy was extremely helpful when I asked her to show me around and locate items.She also made wonderful recommendations. It is clear that she takes a lot of effort to curate and provide a great selection for her customers. She also offers a great selection of materials local to the Vermont and New Hampshire region.
user_reviews.name: William Dahlberg

user_reviews.description: This place is Magical! I love coming here to find new books fo read on a budget. They have a cute cat and great friendly staff. One of the best book stores in Vermont i've been too.
user_reviews.name: isabel andre

user_reviews.description:
The store owners are very nice... The woman owner even gave me a beautiful flower for mother's day... She was the only person who had gave me something for mothers day... She made my day seems how i was with 3 kids..
The Worker Mathaue or known as Catman who works there is a very rude person who goes around spitting in peoples faces...
user_reviews.name: Karri Simpson

user_reviews.description: Great service, the owners recommend good books, and if you're a regular customer, she'll know which books you would enjoy.
user_reviews.name: Ann Wilmot

title: Sandy's Books and Bakery
address: Sandy's Books and Bakery, 30 N Main St, Rochester, VT 05767

user_reviews.description: Must stop here! Super cute little book store and pantry store that sells the most amazing soup. Try the sun tea. Go look around the shop and make sure to get something!
user_reviews.name: Kennedy Andara

user_reviews.description:
Can’t say enough good things about this place: gluten free bagels, cute store, good prices, fast service.

We stopped here because we wanted a quick coffee and ended up staying an hour. It’s rare you see gluten free bagels, much less homemade ones, much less homemade ones that actually taste good!

If you’re in the area, stop by and check it out, you won’t be disappointed. The pinnacle of cafe-ness.

Plus, covered patio for seating.
user_reviews.name: M Borrus

user_reviews.description:
Stopped in for some soup as we were hungry from traveling. It was a perfect combination of bookstore and bakery.

My husband got the Portuguese stew and really enjoyed it. I could not make up my mind so I asked to be surprised. I received the vegan chowder. It was light but flavorful and the bread was fluffy and buttery. Fantastic! We grabbed more snacks for the road on the way out.

I can tell that this food is made with love. Thanks to all those who make this place so amazing!
user_reviews.name: Linda DeMarino

user_reviews.description: Absolutely incredible bookstore. Unique, vintage, rare and autographed one of a kind books of all genres and types. Then add in amazing eats and sauces and food to buy. I bought a smoked maple syrup bbq glaze as well as a maple syrup siracha and both were amazing! Amazing poetry section!
user_reviews.name: Jannina Marie Galarza-Londono

user_reviews.description: I stopped here on a trip with my partner, and they offered lots of delicious treats and goodies. The book store was also packed with a bunch of different books, even an eclectic selection of niche topics.
user_reviews.name: Richard Mobley

user_reviews.description: Such an amazing surprise finding this cozy, wonderful place for breakfast. The egg sandwiche was quite tasty and filling and coffee was great. There are seating options in different rooms surrounded by books and savory. So good!
user_reviews.name: Titka Seddighi

user_reviews.description: We found this little gem of a place while staying outside Rochester. The tomato/rice soap was excellent, as we're the croissants. Will be having their cheddar bagels this morning at home. A must stop while traveling through.
user_reviews.name: Dan W Kirby

user_reviews.description: Great little place to relax with a book and have fresh snacks and drinks. There's locally made creams and soaps. Nestled in a small Vermont community. Was not overcrowded on a Saturday afternoon on our travels to northern Vermont.
user_reviews.name: Christine L

title: Browsing is Arousing
address: Browsing is Arousing, 70 Monroe St, Middlebury, VT 05753

title: Yellow Book
address: Yellow Book, 875 Roosevelt Hwy Suite 220, Colchester, VT 05446

title: Verdant Books
address: Verdant Books, 47 Hazel St, Rutland, VT 05701

title: The Book Nook
address: The Book Nook, 136 Main St, Ludlow, VT 05149

user_reviews.description: Amazing book store and owner! They have such an eclectic collection — I loved browsing and chatting with one of the owners! So glad I stopped in.
user_reviews.name: Christina W

user_reviews.description: Awesome selection and the owner is super sweet. Guess the answer to question of the day to recover a small discount. Also special selection of books by new artist.
user_reviews.name: alexsandra cosme

user_reviews.description: What they lack in quantity they make up for in quality and knowledge.  Plus, they will order any book not in stock for you, and send email updates.  Great Indy book store!!
user_reviews.name: P K-D

user_reviews.description: A rare find. Owner involved and charismatic. Pleasant staff. Large selection. I bought my "Hamilton" book there. Wish we had places like that in Florida!
user_reviews.name: Susan H

user_reviews.description: This store is great. Everything is organized and clearly marked so it's easy to find what you're looking for. Friendly staff and great prices.
user_reviews.name: Dale Sweet

user_reviews.description: The Book Nook is a great local bookstore, and the owner is extremely nice. They even sell books from local authors and have various events throughout the year. Be sure to stop in while in town, you’ll be sure to find a good book.
user_reviews.name: VT Graphics

user_reviews.description: A cute little bookstore, but gentlemen was not very helpful and kind of standoffish.
user_reviews.name: SheCat Fog-Joo

user_reviews.description: Great little book shop. Very well curated selection.
user_reviews.name: John Scott Campbell

title: Blair Books & More
address: Blair Books & More, 58 The Common, Chester, VT 05143

user_reviews.description: This is a super cute little bookstore! On top of an incredible selection, the themed collections were well put together and added to the atmosphere perfectly. The other available knick knacks were also adorable!
user_reviews.name: sarah hochman

user_reviews.description: Super cute small book shop!  She has all the newest and popular books right as you walk in and a fabulous array of genres.  She didn't have a book I asked about and was kind enough to offer ordering it for me.  Great sitting area in the back & adorable little gifts all around like candles and socks, etc.  Loved this shop & her dog Bear!
user_reviews.name: Meliss

user_reviews.description: This place was awesome! Cafe, massive bookstore, used and new books. I found some really unique books here in the used section. Really fun to walk around - it seems endless.
user_reviews.name: Charles Paulin

user_reviews.description: Lovely store with excellent selection of good books, cards, and gifts. Very friendly owner.
user_reviews.name: Diane Strickland

user_reviews.description: Adorable, radical bookstore, with a curated collection of books in all genres including a kids section. They also sell some jewelery and other handmade goods from local artists. There is a juice and smoothie place that is located in the back of the bookstore. I haven't tried it yet, but it looks funky and yummy.
user_reviews.name: Sebastian Greenholtz (greenmntmagpie)

user_reviews.description: Gem of a store I saw while passing through VT. Great selection - picked up a book for my travels, and would absolutely visit again!
user_reviews.name: Sarah Richards

user_reviews.description: My husband and I bought several books which we have already started on! The woman at the desk was incredibly helpful in searching for the books we wanted, and the store was so cozy
user_reviews.name: Shaun Turner

user_reviews.description: I wasn't going to go into this book shop -- time constraints. I'm so glad I did, though. Within minutes I had found two perfect books for children: a "Paint the classics by stickers," including the Renoir dancing couple as an example. The other is a sequel to the revolt of the crayons, here, bringing the crayons back home. (One who was walking out in protest never got out, is waiting for someone to open the door.) Just a funny book that kids, as well as adults, enjoy
user_reviews.name: Althea Allard

title: Sweet Pea & Friends Farm Store
address: Sweet Pea & Friends Farm Store, 15 Gray Way, Essex Junction, VT 05452

title: Pleasant Street Books & Cards
address: Pleasant Street Books & Cards, 48 Pleasant St, Woodstock, VT 05091

user_reviews.description: A very unique experience. The owner was very cool and helpful, not pushy at all but very supportive. The setup is not like anything I’ve ever seen before...it’s basically a house converted into a store. So many unique books and options I’ve not seen elsewhere. You can tell a lot of thought and love went into it.
user_reviews.name: Jeremy Lesser

user_reviews.description: I didn't go upstairs but it seems like the kind of bookstore you go to if you're looking for a 1st edition or a signed copy - mostly older stuff. The gentlemen working there was very nice.
user_reviews.name: Tracey Aldrich

user_reviews.description: Amazing place and the owner is so easy going. A few months ago we went to the bookstore down the street and it was a huge waste of time. Walked down the road and found this gem and we were so happy. I just called, Sonny was insanely helpful and is shipping me my book tomorrow. Such a great experience
user_reviews.name: Elizabeth Noe

user_reviews.description: My husband and I were visiting Woodstock; I really love gems like this bookstore. And love books. It’s a magical place inside and the owner is lovely. I’m already halfway the book I purchased yesterday. Thank you for opening up such a lovely store!
user_reviews.name: Victoria Fisher

user_reviews.description:
Pros: Great variety.  Lots of books in a small space.  Owner very personable.

Cons: Books on the floor make it harder to shop.  Owners desk makes it awkward to get upstairs while he is sitting there.

Prices were pretty reasonable...will be back.
user_reviews.name: Baaye Fevens

user_reviews.description:
Great used book store set back right in the center of Woodstock. Huge art history section on your immediate left. Up stairs you'll find a large selection of African American and Native American studies: larger sections than I've seen at many other book stores in Vermont.

This store has 99% of Huxley's writings including first editions in the case by the piano. A ton of leather-bound Volumes and hard-to-find Vermont specific books. Be sure to have the time and the money because you'll need help leaving.
user_reviews.name: Heineken500

user_reviews.description:
I hope you enjoyed the Boston Braves book - thought you might find this interesting... In Fridya's Boston Globe, a story about a former batboy - called "one of the last living linkss w/ NL baseball" in Boston.
Best wishes - thanks again for your hospitality.
user_reviews.name: Warner Gazette

user_reviews.description: One of my favorite used book stores in the world!
user_reviews.name: David Hildebrand

title: Book Lovers
address: Book Lovers, 49 Flat St, Brattleboro, VT 05301

user_reviews.description: I stopped in Brattleboro and had to check out Book Lovers! This is a really sweet used bookstore tucked away in an adorable Vermont town. As a used book collector, I was seriously impressed with the selection. The owner Ian had such a great mix of fiction, non fiction, and more specialized genres. I particularly have to shout out the selection in the new fiction section. There were well-priced, like-new copies of some of the most popular fiction books of the last few years. Can’t wait to come back!
user_reviews.name: Erin Batchelder

user_reviews.description: I was only in Brattleboro for a couple hours but try to visit small bookstores everywhere I go, and I’m so glad I made it to Book Lovers! I completely lost track of time browsing in the comfortable and well-curated shop and then had a good chat with Ian at checkout. The shop alone is reason enough to come back to Brattleboro!
user_reviews.name: Grace Ramsdell

user_reviews.description: Fun, well-curated used books store. All books were of very high quality. The owner knows how collection very, very well, and the clever signs on the shelves kept making me laugh!
user_reviews.name: Vanessa Bright, LAc LP

user_reviews.description: Book Lovers is unpretentious, well-priced, and full of gems. It has an especially good selection of used books from recent decades, and they’re well-sorted so you can find delightful titles without feeling overwhelmed. It would be a mistake to miss this store while you’re in Brattleboro.
user_reviews.name: Danielle Drees

user_reviews.description:
My family and I visited Book Lovers while on a short weekend away in Brattleboro and left with a handful of books and a really welcoming interaction with the shop owner! The shop is just slightly tucked back from the road so keep your eye out!
We will definitely be coming back on our next visit.
user_reviews.name: Liz A.

user_reviews.description: This used bookstore has the most well-curated and Eclectic collection of any bookstore I've been in. The owner is extremely knowledgeable about books and is able to recommend books of additional interest to customers. It's a great place just to browse for hours.
user_reviews.name: Alfred New

user_reviews.description:
Book Lovers is exactly the type of store Brattleboro needs, as it’s exactly the type of store I grew up finding in Brattleboro.  Ian, the owner, is extremely knowledgeable and welcoming and will engage you in exactly the kind of conversation you hope to find in a small town bookstore.  I popped in looking for something specific, a paperback edition of the complete and uncut The Stand, and wouldn’t you know it, Ian was able to pull that exact copy off of his shelf which turned into a 45 minute conversation about King and what is involved in him creating something “complete and uncut”, leading to a conversation about graphic novels, and the history of comics, and talking about stores from over the years that Brattleboro has lost.

Do yourself a favor, if you’re looking for a book and some engaging conversation with someone who loves the world of books, go to Book Lovers.  You won’t regret it.

address: Second Hand Prose, 1222 Main St #101, St Johnsbury, VT 05819

user_reviews.description: Wonderful place to find good books and their donation model made this a fantastic experience. Everything was well organized and sorted with a diverse selection of fiction and nonfiction. We also were able to bring our well behaved dog inside and she was greeted with a bowl of fresh water. You can’t ask for a better book-buying experience!
user_reviews.name: Sarah Kohl

user_reviews.description: What a lovely bookstore. There was a large selection and everything is well-organized. I had a nice chat with the volunteers who were very helpful and thoughtful gave me suggestions for places in town to visit.
user_reviews.name: Indoorsy Ren

user_reviews.description: Wonderful staff (volunteers?)helped me choose some good reads. All the books are bought by donation. I love that our community has this available.
user_reviews.name: Julia McKinley

user_reviews.description: Lovely store! Has a great selection and you never know what you will find. It's like a treasure hunt! They keep it well organized. Book prices are by donation which is really nice of them to make books accessible to everyone. They take donations of books which is great also!
user_reviews.name: Manda H

user_reviews.description:
Not much selection.
Weird hours.
Clerk promised free bag with purchase of children's books. Paid more than listed price for a few books as clerk said book prices were "by donation". She then asked me if I wanted the free bag and told me goodbye when I said yes. Maybe she misunderstood me, but I was disappointed with the whole experience.
user_reviews.name: Alyssa Hamilton

user_reviews.description:
Wonderful, comfortable little place to get books at reasonable prices.  Volunteers are very friendly - highly recommended!!

NOTE:  I called the St. J. Atheneum and was told they are temporarily closed due to COVID.  The bookstore is an annex of the library.

user_reviews.description: Favorite place to get books! Great deals and it gives back to the community.

user_reviews.description: What a beautiful little oyster up on the hill :)

title: The Book Garden
address: The Book Garden, 50 State St, Montpelier, VT 05602

user_reviews.description:
This place has everything a card collector like me could ever want. From magic cards to sky blue sleeves, they have it all! I really enjoy everything you have to offer and your kindness to customers. The service from the staff is incredible, and everyone who comes here is an incredibly kind and friendly.

-Manny V. and Griffin H.
user_reviews.name: Griffin Hilke

user_reviews.description:
Great!! locally owned and operated book, comic, game store. They really have an excellent smattering of curious used books, engaging new titles, a whole swath of comics and graphic novels and the freshest table top games. And the staff is super knowledgeable and always friendly, 🐾🐕 friendly too.

I do wish they had more room to serve tea and let you play games, I would take friends old and new here more; typically I just graze the 'out of my budget' board games and leave empty handed. Totally worth checking out though.
user_reviews.name: Conni Mags

user_reviews.description: Small local book store with a lackluster gaming section.   No Used RPG’s.   No miniatures other than a small handful.   No dice sets.   No paints.
user_reviews.name: RMeischker

user_reviews.description: We stopped by here accidentally whilst in Montpelier…it’s like a treasure trove of amazing books and games! Whilst we didn’t buy anything we were amazed at the sheer selection of games …fabulous!
user_reviews.name: Adam Proctor

user_reviews.description: Went in looking for a similar leather journal to that my friend bought there previously. The person there point me to exactly where it would be if they had it in.
user_reviews.name: Herbie Carleton

user_reviews.description: An awesome store with a huge selection of games, Magic items, graphic novels, and other items. Great for experienced players to those just starting out. Staffs' recommendations for my partner and I have always been great as have their age-specific recommendations for my young niece. We are so lucky to have this resource in our community!

user_reviews.description: Excellent customer service, knowledgeable about the board games we were looking into and the guy who helped us was very friendly. Will definitely be coming here again for board games, books and magic cards! They apparently are also going to be doing monthly board game nights which sounds great! Highly recommend.
user_reviews.name: A L

user_reviews.description:
Cannot wait for the store to start magic the gathering/board games/ttrpg games. I havent lived here long but have noticed that the area is limited on local game stores for magic in particular. Brad the owner is very nice, patient and knowledgeable.
I almost didn't stop by because I wasn't sure this place had mtg but I'm very glad I did.
user_reviews.name: Sean Flanagan

title: Earth Prime Comics
address: Earth Prime Comics, 154 Church St, Burlington, VT 05401

user_reviews.description:
Friendly staff, good selection, delightful little shop.

I was on vacation from VA and stopped by multiple times to pick up things to read.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable when I asked for recommendations.  Really glad I stopped by.
user_reviews.name: Tim Cosgrove

user_reviews.description:
I was very impressed by how knowledgeable and friendly the staff were. Amazing selection of comics as well. After chatting with the staff I was immediately impressed and purchased a copy of Locke & Key (which is FAR better as a comic than a tv series by the way if you didn't know already).

5 stars and I will definitely be returning to buy more comics from this place!
user_reviews.name: Wesley Van Auken

user_reviews.description: Awesome staff and had a fun discussion with them when I went to check out. Nice selection of new issues, trades, hardcovers, figures, puzzles, and kids comics. Very happy I stopped by while I was in the area on vacation!
user_reviews.name: Garrett Oliver

user_reviews.description:
I completely disagree with the other person who reviewed. I thought the customer service was excellent. The person working was very polite and friendly with me, and I found my overall experience there to be very good. Having worked in retail, I can only suggest that the other reviewer may not have been very friendly him/herself and may have been annoying the worker with their attitude (because yes, employees have feelings and bad days too).
I wish the store was a bit bigger and had more product, but it's a reasonable size considering that comics don't offer a lot of profit.
user_reviews.name: Stephanie Landry

user_reviews.description: Awesome store. Super helpful, friendly, and chill staff.  Very knowledgeable and willing to try and help track down and special order harder to find items.  I've only ever encountered complete courtesy here.  Of course the inventory can be a bit small as the comics and print industry is flagging in general and seeing how we are in Vermont, we're lucky to even have a comic store in such a prime location.  All I can say to the lower star reviews here is that I would not be surprised that they are written by people who find life in general to be filled with much disappointment--lighten up.
user_reviews.name: Chrlstopher D

user_reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere, love the comic selection, and I especially loved the knowledge of the comic shop clerk. He went above and beyond to try and find the comics I was asking for. He was educated on the literature, and friendly too. Will shop her again soon.
user_reviews.name: Jovan Ramirez

user_reviews.description: They have awesome selection of new comics. The owner was very helpful and friendly. They made two of us the happy campers!
user_reviews.name: Ruixuan Hao

user_reviews.description: got off the phone with a guy about the store and signed up for some subscriptions. Was already thinking how nice they seemed. Went there and my time was amazing, the people here know their stuff and are kind to the customers. Just the way it should be. Excelsior!
user_reviews.name: Thereal Jaskaransingh

title: Brattleboro Books
address: Brattleboro Books, 36 Elliot St, Brattleboro, VT 05301

user_reviews.description: Brattleboro is blessed to have so many used bookstores in a town of its size. Brattleboro Books is, to my knowledge, the original one here. There is an extensive collection of all genres, with a pretty impressive collection of theology, philosophy, and science — impressive given its lack of proximity to a major university. I found an original English edition of Gabriel Marcel here and for those of you who know who that is, it’s a hint as to the hidden gems you can find here.
user_reviews.name: Suraj Nyalakonda

user_reviews.description:
I grew up in Southern Vermont and moved to Atlanta in 2018. In early 2023 I made it back home for the first time in 5 years. As a lover of books I knew I had to stop in to check it out.

The store is comfortable and visually stunning. There are many shelves loaded with desirable titles. Prices are reasonable. In fact, I found a hardcover of Darkness at Noon for $12, and the cheapest you can get it online is for $49. Additionally, I picked up a hardcover of Tacitus' Complete Works for $15, while the cheapest one I could find online was $72.

I will make it a priority to stop in every time I'm in the area. The owner was a pleasure to talk with as well.
user_reviews.name: Brian A

user_reviews.description: A cozy bookstore with a good mix of contemporary works and classics. A good collection of contemporary plays and a lot of children's books in good condition.
user_reviews.name: Samantha deManbey

user_reviews.description:
I always leave with a few new treasures. Awesome place to book-hunt and find new gems! A book lover's dream!

To those of you who are saying the books are overpriced, that ain't so. I worked in a library for 3 years, where I was constantly checking for the replacement prices of books, so I developed a pretty good feel for the cost of a book. Gheesh, in many cases, it's a book I myself remember researching for my job, and I know the price off the top of my head! Altogether, these books are priced according to their value. You might get an underpriced one at a garage sale or a Goodwill, where nobody knows how to research books, but that's a gamble and you could wait for years for an accidental deal like that. If you want the book now, then these books are priced correctly and are the best you'll ever find in a bookstore, either brick-and-mortar or online!

Public library book sales can afford to be dirt cheap because they're just trying to get rid of excess books and it's either practically give them away or dump them. Also, your public library doesn't have to make money -  it is funded by your tax dollars. Book stores don't run on the same logic, so they can't afford to give away their books for a few bucks here and there. That is why library sales underprice, but actual book stores price correctly according to the going value.
user_reviews.name: Stargazer

user_reviews.description: I was visiting from Brooklyn—a haven for used bookstores—but even still, Brattleboro Books is one of the best bookstores, period, I've ever been to! I walked away with something like 15 treasures (beautiful editions of rare or out-of-print or eccentric books)—and that was me holding myself back. Also, the owner seemed very kind and friendly.
user_reviews.name: Kit Duckworth

user_reviews.description: Nice selection but there prices are outrageous. Way too much for used books, especially considering that the prices are written on the inside of the books. I didn't find anything under jacket price and first editions were going for way more than the book value. I didn't have it there but I probably won't go back
user_reviews.name: David Vance

user_reviews.description: This family owned bookstore is a gem. You can’t not find something to read, gift to a friend or family, or just peruse. Worth a stop anytime you’re in Brattleboro.
user_reviews.name: Sarah Wolfe

user_reviews.description: A great bookstore! Owner is super friendly and helpful. If you love books you want to stop at this place (and while you are there stop at Everyone's Books across the street.. another book lover s paradise!)
user_reviews.name: Kenneth DiMaggio

title: Norwich University Bookstore
address: Norwich University Bookstore, Harmon Hall, 158 Harmon Dr, Northfield, VT 05663

user_reviews.description: No visit to campus would be complete without a trip to the bookstore to update Norwich gear! It's always very busy on the big weekends. The staff is helpful, friendly and cheerful! Well worth the visit and know I can order online at any time, too! Norwich Forever!

user_reviews.description: Very well stocked, although there was a dirth of books. Previous visits had full shelves, so I didn't deduct any stars as it was alumni weekend.

user_reviews.description: I'm an alumn. When they rebuilt I would have expected a larger store. The racks are really close together. They did well with the 200th Homecoming crowd though. Kudos to the store staff on that one!

user_reviews.description: I think I can say this as I am alumni now, WAY overpriced, but certainly fun stuff to remember one's journey through this historic university.

user_reviews.description: Plenty of quality swag as well as school supplies.  Nice and helpful employees.

One of the workers, I believe the Manager, was rude and condescending, when I went back to explain my situation. Will never by a textbook from here again.

user_reviews.description: Tons of great merchandise,  Norwich Strong!

user_reviews.description: I,be lived in the area since 1981 and have never seen this place open.
